Job Title: Sr. Director, Business Development
Group / Team: Growth/ Accounts & Sales
Reports to: VP, Business Development
Location: Remote
Employment Type: FT, Salaried, Exempt
Travel Requirement: 30%

OPUS AGENCY

Opus Agency partners with world-shaping brands like Amazon, Google, Microsoft, and Salesforce to catalyze movements through shared experiences. Crafted through our end-to-end capabilities and propelled from the epicenter of events, content, and community, these experiences are renowned for accelerating momentum—and success—for everyone involved.

Built across four decades, we scale excellence at the forefront of focused strategy, fearless creativity, emerging technology, and agile delivery. Today, as the flagship of The Opus Group, our team members are outperforming from hubs throughout the United States, in the heart of London, and around the world.

If you embody our cultural pillars—if you can bring versatility, embody optimism, elevate integrity, catalyze curiosity, and own excellence—then join us in fueling the future of brand movements.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

At Opus, we place high importance on building strong client relations. Business Development plays a key role in receiving, vetting, and managing the process of the Agency response on opportunities both known and new. The Sr. Director, Business Development is responsible to find opportunities within accounts that drive growth for both clients and revenue for the agency. Revenue targets, established at the beginning of the calendar year, will identify a mix of current account and net new business desired to achieve and exceed the goal. The Sr. Director, Business Development is a highly collaborative, influential, and experienced senior leader responsible for managing and overseeing a team that initiates and closes sales opportunities, that significantly accelerates the Agency’s growth and profitability and helps fulfill the company’s vision. This position achieves these goals by developing and implementing the company’s business development strategy and tactics.

The Sr. Director, Business Development understands the client’s business needs and strategy and finds opportunities for Opus to meet those needs (sales). The Sr. Director, Business Development will develop positive, trusting, value-add relationships with clients, provides leadership necessary to increasingly align Opus offerings with client objectives, and own overall responsibility for account revenue targets and profitability goals.

The Sr. Director, Business Development works closely with the agency to create opportunities and growth for the agency.

Key Responsibilities:
• Develops and maintains strong client relationships and creates client success by providing unique and effective solutions to our clients
• Maintains leading-edge knowledge of clients’ culture, processes, structure, business, and industry to service them effectively and is responsible for the overall satisfaction and retention of client(s)
• Possesses and learns complete knowledge of Opus Agency as a company, our service offerings and the competitive landscape of our industry
• Shows value across all agency service lines and effectively communicates client needs to direct teams to successful delivery
• Guides the development, writing, and presentation of incremental project proposals, scopes of work, schedules and staffing plans
• Drives and leads new business pitches and grows account portfolio via service line growth and new events
• Maintains a passion for the brand strategy and can have the complex conversations at a broader business level and sell in the strategic story
• Reports on accountability for all aspects of the clients’ business
• Maintains a dashboard to track all key client metrics and plans deliverables and creates action plans to achieve key metrics
• Owns the overall responsibility for account revenue targets and profitability goals
• Manages budget process form a profit generation perspective including expense management, client quoting, and profit modeling
• Is responsible for managing and overseeing the Business Development Team
• Stays abreast of client billing escalation issues and ensures they are being resolved
• Forecasts budget estimates and percent to close rations for pipeline reports and manages scope creep and client’s budgets to maintain profitability
• Provides leadership necessary to direct and motivate Opus team members across disciplines (strategy, creative, production, and finance) to contribute and deliver absolute best work while exceeding client expectations
• Conceptualizes strategic client programs, understanding the in-depth view of the account as a whole along with industry insight
• Responsible for keeping an eye on the client accounts as a whole and how we are being measured on all projects produced within an account
• Manages for account success and client relationship, understands event cycles and customer needs and creates customer/partner relationship
• Provides fresh strategic ideas to grow and expand the account and adds vision and creativity to client programs
• Participates in development of new product lines, modification of existing product lines, & termination of ineffective product lines in an effective and professional manner
• Grows Account business and meet revenue goals through a solid understanding of all Opus product lines and ability to upsell/cross-sell services
• Drives revenue through recognition and realization of opportunity with existing accounts
• Keeps abreast of latest industry trends in order to keep program fresh and on the cutting edge within the client’s industry

Core Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent, 5 plus years of related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience
• Strong ability to manage and build relationships and trust with multiple stakeholders internal and external to the organization
• 3-5 years’ experience selling multiple event service solutions; focus on creative and experiential sales beneficial
• Excellent people and management skills to interact with staff, colleagues, cross- functional teams and third parties
• Experience with enterprise high tech clients (Intel, Microsoft, Oracle, etc.) a plus
• Experience with budget management, financial tracking and contract negotiations
• Knowledge of accounting, marketing and sales tactics/strategies
• Strong organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills
• Ability to make sound business decisions based upon researched and known data
• Ability to work independently and collaborate with others to identify issues and develop solutions
• Strong influence-management, negotiation, leadership and assertiveness capabilities
• Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
• Strong ability to prioritize deadlines and manage multiple workstreams as an individual contributor
• Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm
• Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple projects and deliver quick results

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT IN RETURN
• Full time position
• Opportunities for growth and development
• Health & Dental Insurance (choice of plans)
• 100% Employer paid short-term disability and life insurance
• Opportunity to elect additional life insurance and LTD insurance at employee expense
• Paid parental leave
• Opportunity to contribute pre-tax dollars to flexible spending accounts
• 401(K) with employer match
• Flexibility in work schedules
• Generous time off

HOW WE’LL TAKE CARE OF YOU

Our job titles may span more than one career level. The starting salary for this role is between $120,000 and $150,000. Our salary ranges are based on third-party national average market compensation analysis. The actual salary is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs, and market demands. The salary range is subject to change and may be modified in the future.

NOT SURE IF YOU SHOULD APPLY?

Studies show that those identifying as under-represented individuals might have talked themselves out of applying at this point. Don’t worry about checking every single box. At Opus Agency, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic team – so if you’re excited about this role, but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every single qualification in this job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may just be the right candidate for this role or we may have other roles that better align with your skillset.

Physical Requirements:

Individuals will be required to sit for the majority of the day and will be required to stand as needed. May require walking primarily on a level surface for periodic periods throughout the day. Reaching above shoulder heights, below the waist or lifting as required to file documents or store materials throughout the workday. Proper lifting techniques required. Individuals will be required to travel via airplane, train, taxi, car and/or other means of transportation as needed.

The job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.”

OTHER DUTIES AND ACKNOWLEDGEMENT

The above noted job description is not intended to describe, in detail, the multitude of tasks that may be assigned but rather to give the employee/ candidate a general sense of the responsibilities and expectations of the position. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. This does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an "at will" relationship. This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

Opus Agency does not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
